author: sky.cactus
content:
> We‚Äôre trying to emulate geth as much as possible to help users with muscle memory and they do ‚Äúgeth accounts new‚Äù as well as list, import, export
I don't think that emulating Geth here is worth much at all.  Client account management has been on the way out for years and users have been repeatedly told to not use Ethereum clients for key (account) management, so hopefully very few users are actually familiar with those commands.

author: raulj
content: It‚Äôs nothing out of this world, it‚Äôs just basic account command structure that many users of our client have been asking for <@301186049323958275>

author: sky.cactus
content: Ugh.  Why are users asking for a syntax that aligns with a tool that they shouldn't be using!

author: raulj
content: new, list, import, export seem pretty straightforward to me. What do you suggest instead?

author: raulj
content: No cli at all?

author: sky.cactus
content: Nothing in particular, I was _only_ arguing against "Geth muscle memory" as a design goal.

author: sky.cactus
content: Having it look/feel like a tool no one should be using doesn't seem like a good design goal to me.  If you happen to land on a syntax that looks similar because it is otherwise a good design then that is fine, just don't **target** Geth compatibility.

author: raulj

content: Personally, I would much rather see clients serve up a little web app for account management so regular users can use it.
